courseDescription:
Mental health support workers play an important function in the treatment of those suffering from mental health problems. This course outlines the role of mental health support workers and identifies the characteristics, credentials and skills that they require to excel. We then look at the roles of mental health first aiders and the legalities surrounding their work.

This course examines numerous mental health problems, including schizophrenia, personality disorders, eating and sleeping issues, stress and anxiety disorders and psychiatric issues affecting children and adolescents. Any intellectual, emotional or behavioural impairment that is considered ‘clinically substantial’ is a marker of a mental illness. Such markers are frequently associated with distress or functional limitations in important areas, representing a wide range of distinct mental illnesses.

We then show you how to identify the many medications used to treat psychiatric problems. What law governs the rights of patients suffering from mental health issues? Become familiar with mental health legislation, community mental health teams (CMHTs) and methods for dealing with those who are experiencing a mental health crisis. This course explains how to assist those who are struggling with mental health issues to regain their mental wellbeing. This course is suitable for social workers and anyone who intends to assist in the day-to-day care of patients in mental care facilities. It also suits anyone who wants to learn more about common mental health disorders and the measures used to treat them.
